author: yim
part_1: The word "squirrel", first specified in 1327, comes from Anglo-Norman esquirel from the Old French escurel, the reflex of a Latin word sciurus.
part_2: This Latin word was borrowed from the Ancient Greek word σκίουρος, skiouros, which means shadow-tailed, referring to the bushy appendage possessed by many of its members.

author: mid

part_1: In general, the hind limbs are longer than the fore limbs, and they have four or five toes on each paw.
